instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
threads.message:
Working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has a headphone issue; the left channel only is very muffled/restricted, as if it's not being boosted/amplified properly. It's at around 10% of normal proper volume. Right channel works great.

1. Already replaced jack.
2. Replaced <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>, as it had seen liquid.
3. Line between <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C6300</CAPACITOR> was broken/burned, so repaired that.
4. Checked and replaced all diodes and filters on the left channel, no change.
5. Diode readings for L and R channels on J6700 (pins 1/3) are .608.

I've already replaced <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and continuity is fine from pins 38/40 to L6704 and L6706. L6704 and L6706 replaced just for the hell of it. Also replaced jack to be sure...so I'm totally and utterly lost at this point. I'm sure I'm missing something obvious, but I can't stand small audio issues like this. They always get the best of me.

Any help is appreciated.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
threads.message: The problem persists on internal speakers and headphones too?

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
threads.message: Internal speakers (left and right) work fine, not muffled at all. The only issue is the left headphone not having full volume--it does work, just very, very low volume (~10%). It's very similar to when an amp blows/fails, how you can still hear the volume, but it's super low. I hope that makes sense.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
threads.message:
Thank you; I removed <CAPACITOR>C6500</CAPACITOR> and there was no change. Left-channel headphones still extremely low-volumed. Any other ideas?

Thanks again for all help!

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Audio Issue...left channel headphones muffled.
threads.message: Try removing DZ6706 too; also check L6706...
